body:
Maximilienne Guyon was an award-winning painter, illustrator, and etcher. She exhibited often, primarily in France, and won numerous awards, receiving the traveling purse in 1894, the first woman to whom it was given.

She was held in high regard as a teacher, instructing the Princess Mathilde (of Saxony), who in her own right became a talented artist.

Mme. Guyon was a successful portrait painter, having the ability to “unmask” the subject by artfully rendering individual characteristics of which they were previously unaware. 

High auction record for this artist is $9,770.
dimensions: Watercolor, 17.25 x 10.25 inches / Signed lower left
metaTitle: Maximilienne Goepp Guyon - Lady Waving Painting For Sale
metaDescription: Maximilienne Goepp Guyon, French Artist From 1868-1903 - Lady Waving Watercolor Painting For Sale - 17.25x10.25 Inches - Signed Lower Left.
title: Lady Waving
